fields.how_data_was_processed: Combined the zipcode data with tax lot information to create an interactive map of NYC energy use.
Used the script TSV2JSON.py to connect the TSV data to a JSON keyed to the city's zipcodes.
derivative: Energy Zip - JSONed data for app

fields.how_data_was_processed: Merged the 2010 electricity consumption with median income and other zipcode level data. Calculated means and rank in the city's zipcodes. Worked to figure out why some zipcodes have non-zero population, but zero electricity use.

derivative: Energy Zip - JSONed data for app

fields.how_data_was_processed: Converted from Shapefile to GeoJSON by Pediacities.
Downloaded, stripped back and collated into a TSV file with other relevant NYC Census data and the Electric Consumption data from NYC
source: Median Value of Owner Occupied Housing Units, NYC

fields.how_data_was_processed: Downloaded, stripped back and collated into a TSV file with other relevant NYC Census data and the Electric Consumption data from NYC
source: Households and Families: 2010 Census Summary File 1, NYC

fields.how_data_was_processed: Downloaded, stripped back and collated into a TSV file with other relevant NYC Census data and the Electric Consumption data from NYC
source: Median Income In The Past 12 Months, NYC
